body: @jo-kin I have no access to z/OS . Would you be interested to submit a PR ?

@normanmaurer Already thought so, too. Currently I try to persuade my employer to get involved with Netty development. It's obvious, that I am not the owner of the used mainframe...
Give me some time, please.

issue.title: Don't use VM.maxDirectMemory() on z/OS to retrieve direct memory limit.

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

On z/OS netty initializes this value with 64M, even the direct accessible memory is actually unbounded.

Modifications:

Skip usage of VM.maxDirectMemory() on z/OS.

Result:

More correct direct memory limit detection. Fixes https://github.com/netty/netty/issues/7654.

body: FYI, I am able to reproduce this issue on Windows with the latest IBM Java 8 JRE. Setting '-XX:MaxDirectMemorySize=512M' works around the problem, however. I am running Spark 2.2, which ships with Netty-all-4.0.43.Final. It does not appear to be specific to Z/OS.
@jpfourny so it may be more specific to ibm JVM then... Can you show me what the System property "java.vendor" contains ?
